alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 09 at 2:17PM PST until December 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST SATURDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Local winds gusting as high as 45 mph will cause blowing and drifting of snow. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulations greater than 12 inches are expected near the crest. The cities of La Pine and Sunriver should expect snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
